documentType: Bureau of Prisons internal correspondence and suicide risk assessment forms
summary: This document contains Bureau of Prisons internal emails and suicide risk assessment forms related to inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It includes a suggestion to house him with another sex offender, updates on his psychological observation status, and detailed suicide risk assessment protocols. This document is a collection of administrative records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, primarily from August 10, 2019. It includes a memorandum detailing the medical emergency and transport of inmate Jeffrey Epstein, official count sheets, and telephone call logs. The core of the document is the report of Epstein's medical emergency in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and his subsequent transport to a hospital. This document is a detailed telephone call log from August 9-10, 2019, showing numerous calls placed from a specific station/circuit (04-01-13). It records timestamps, call statuses, and dialed numbers, but does not contain the content of conversations or identify specific individuals by name. This document contains a Bureau of Prisons psychological intake screening for Jeffrey Epstein dated July 8, 2019, assessing his mental health and risk of sexual abusiveness. It also includes call log data from August 10, 2019, showing calls to/from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and a form referencing original interview notes of a victim (V1U). This document contains a Bureau of Prisons psychology services note from July 8, 2019, detailing suicide risk factors for inmate Jeffrey Epstein and instructions for monitoring him upon his return from court. It also includes multiple FBI FD-340c evidence receipt forms and FD-597 property receipts, along with technical scan reports from August 2019, indicating the collection and processing of evidence.

events.title: Housing suggestion for Epstein
events.description: A doctor from Central Office contacts a Bureau of Prisons psychologist, suggesting housing inmate Jeffrey Epstein with another sex offender in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). The psychologist agrees to discuss the suggestion with executive staff.

events.title: Epstein removed from Psych Observation
events.description: An internal email states that inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) is being taken off of Psych Observation and needs to be housed with an appropriate cellmate. He is not on Suicide Watch.

events.title: Epstein Medical Emergency in SHU
events.description: At 6:33am, a body alarm and medical emergency was called for inmate Jeffrey Epstein in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). Staff responded, 911 was called, and EMS arrived at 6:43am. Epstein was transported via ambulance to a local hospital at 7:10am.

events.title: Evening phone call activity
events.description: A series of phone calls were logged from station/circuit 02-04-16, including a 1-minute and 6-second conversation.

events.title: Overnight and morning phone call activity
events.description: Extensive phone call activity was logged from station/circuit 04-01-13 throughout the early morning hours (12:21 AM to 9:24 AM), showing numerous calls placed, answered, and in conversation.

events.title: Epstein's Prison Intake Screening
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein undergoes a psychological intake screening at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (MCC-NY). He is assessed for mental health history, current symptoms, and risk of sexual abusiveness.

events.title: Calls to/from Special Housing Unit
events.description: A series of short-duration phone calls are logged between the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and a control station, occurring in the early morning hours.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: A Bureau of Prisons psychologist consults with Dr. Central Office regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein's suicide risk factors, including his high-profile case, sex offense charges, and an upcoming court proceeding. Instructions are given to place him on watch status upon return from court.

events.title: Evidence Scan at NY GCAB MCC
events.description: Registration reports and scan point statistics are generated for cluster scans at a location (likely a Metropolitan Correctional Center in NY), indicating detailed 3D scanning of an area or cell.

keyFacts: On July 25, 2019, a BOP Central Office doctor suggested housing Jeffrey Epstein with another sex offender in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
On July 30, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was taken off Psych Observation and needed to be housed with an appropriate cellmate; he was not on Suicide Watch at that time.
The document includes detailed Bureau of Prisons suicide risk assessment protocols and forms, indicating the institutional focus on Epstein's mental state and suicide risk.
On August 10, 2019, at 6:33 AM, a medical emergency was declared for Jeffrey Epstein in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) of the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Epstein was transported from the MCC to a local hospital via ambulance and a BOP escort chase car, departing the institution at 7:10 AM.
The document includes official inmate count sheets from MCC New York dated August 10, 2019, showing a total census of 758 inmates.
Telephone call logs from August 9-10, 2019, show numerous calls, including several 'LINE TO CONFERENCE' calls, from a station identified as 04-01-13.
A memorandum from the Correctional Systems Officer documents the sequence of events for the medical emergency, including notification of NYPD and response by EMS.
The document is a raw telephone system call log, capturing technical details like timestamps, caller circuits, dialed numbers, and call statuses (DIALING, ANSWER, IN CONVERSATION, BUSY).
The log shows high-frequency calling activity from specific stations/circuits (primarily 04-01-13 and 02-04-16) over a roughly 24-hour period from August 9 to August 10, 2019.
No personal identifiers (names), conversation content, or contextual information about the purpose of the calls is present in this log excerpt.
The dialed numbers are partially visible in some records (e.g., 04-08-03, 04-09-05, 01-14-23, 03-09-08, 03-14-02), suggesting internal extensions or specific external numbers.
The document appears to be a technical record likely obtained as part of a forensic investigation into communications.

Jeffrey Epstein's Bureau of Prisons psychological intake screening found no history or current symptoms of mental health issues, no suicidal ideation, and he was assigned a low risk of sexual abusiveness within the facility.
The screening notes Epstein was incarcerated for sex trafficking and had a prior three-month incarceration for prostitution.
Epstein declined participation in any treatment or programming recommendations offered by the prison psychology services.
Call logs from August 10, 2019, show multiple brief calls between the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and a control station, occurring around the time of Epstein's death.
A form (FD-340c) references 'Original notes re interview of V1U', indicating documentation of a victim interview, though the victim's name is not provided in this excerpt.

On July 8, 2019, Bureau of Prisons psychology staff identified Jeffrey Epstein as having 'arious risk factors for suicidality' including his high-profile case, sex offense charges, and a court proceeding that day.
Instructions were given for R&D staff and Lieutenants to notify the psychology department immediately upon Epstein's return from court and to place him on a suicide watch if he returned after hours.
The document includes multiple FBI evidence receipt forms (FD-340c, FD-597), indicating the ongoing collection and processing of physical and interview evidence related to the case.
Technical scan reports from August 17, 2019, show detailed 3D scanning was conducted at a location labeled 'NY_GCAB_MCC', likely the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
